title: Calendar Reminders Not Showing

I am using Version 140.1 on Firefox.
creator: Oldneweng

title: Thunderbird 140.0.1 is resource hungry
content:
I am experiencing a severe problem with Thunderbird. There are several symptoms: 1) The CPU utilization of Thunderbird is typically 13-19%. 2) Thunderbird declares that it was able to send a message and to save it, but that it experienced difficulty when running filters. 3) Thunderbird is unable to compact a folder. The message received is: 

   The folder 'Inbox on william.atwood@concordia.ca' could not be compacted because writing to folder failed.  Verify that you have enough disk space, and that you have write privileges to the file system, then try again.

4) Thunderbird occasionally gives the following error message: Your message was sent but a copy was not placed in your sent folder (Sent) due to network or file access errors. You can retry or save the message locally to Local Folders/Sent-william.atwood@concordia.ca.

These are the symptoms that I see today. Over the longer term, I saw the following:

1) Thunderbird started to behave strangely several weeks ago. It somehow lost track of what messages it had downloaded, so it started downloading all of the message headers in my inboxes (and other folders). (I have six email accounts that I monitor.)

2) Since all of my accounts are IMAP accounts, with the messages stored on the server, I tried replacing the Thunderbird profile with a copy that I had previously backed up. This seemed to solve the problem for a short time. However, the symptoms soon re-appeared, including high CPU utilization, inability to compact folders, and difficulty running filters.

3) At the suggestion of my employer's help desk, I removed and re-installed Thunderbird. This found the existing Thunderbird profile, and everything seemed to work just fine for a few days. Then, suddenly, everything went haywire, and Thunderbird started re-loading all of the message headers for *all* of my folders (and for all of the accounts), and complaining about inability to run filters or compact folders.

Finally, Thunderbird crashed today. I added notes to the crash report, giving some of the details above. After it restarted, it crashed again. I finally ended up restarting my computer.

Thunderbird version 140.0.1 Windows 11 Edition Windows 11 Enterprise Version 24H2 Installed on ‎2025-‎04-‎30 OS build 26100.4349 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.26100.107.0

What can I do to mitigate this problem? It is very difficult to use Thunderbird when it acts like this.

Bill Atwood
creator: williamatwood41

title: Request to retrieve opening page format
content: Hi, I have been used to seeing a 'New Message' panel and the list of tasks including 'File' 'View' 'Edit' 'Tools' etc on Thunderbird's opening email screen for many years. I may have mistakenly made the modification which has resulted in them no longer appearing. I am still able to send emails via clicking on the mail symbol next to my email address and then clicking 'Write a new message' but prefer to avoid this step. I usually click on 'File' to empty the Deleted emails but as above, 'File' etc doesn't show. Neither do the number of emails in my Deleted file. The panel below the list of email files now shows 'Welcome to Freedom' which is new. I am an old codger eighty years old and my computer skills are fairly modest. I hope you can provide a simple fix. Regards, David Wilson
creator: terjesen

title: Error on quitting Thunderbird (macOS 10.15 Desktop)
content:
This behavior started suddenly today. Every time I quit Thunderbird (by selecting "Quit Thunderbird" from the drop down menu) the program appears to close normally, but about a second or two later I get a pop up saying "thunderbird quit unexpectedly". Happens every time I close the application. Otherwise everything seems to be working fine within the program itself. I checked for crash logs, there are none. I tried running in Troubleshoot Mode, same behavior.

Any ideas? Maybe just a fresh re-install?
creator: bastian.nick

title: Eeste gestor, no me detecta los correos SPAM.
content: 21/07/2025. Hola - Disculpe señor. No soy muy ducho - Le pido perdón. Abro un nuevo hilo . . . - Está bien ? - - - Antecedentes : Mi primera pregunta 06/04/2025. Tengo este problemita : De vez en cuando recibo correos SPAM y este gestor no me los detecta. Como debería configurar, para que cuando me llegue un correo SPAM, me avise y lo detecte ? Aclaro, que solamente me entero cuando voy a mi correo en la web, y ahí sí, lo veo. Muchas gracias - Saludos cordiales. - - - Su contestación 6/4/2025. Hola, Adjunte una captura de la configuración de la cuenta "opciones de correo basura" (su versión puede tener un nombre diferente pero similar a este), en este menú tiene una explicación de su funcionamiento, donde se refiere a "entrenar" estud deberá en un principio marcar que correos son spam. Ademas puede agregar una funcionalidad ms antispam marcando la opción de "Confiar en los encabezados de basura de..", estos son servidores de detección de spam. Saludos - - - Su respuesta 7/4/2025. Hola, Están correctas esas configuraciones, pero en la última captura puede activar también "Activar el registro del filtro adaptativo de correo basura" PD: Cuando escribe un correo lo hace también todo en mayúscula ? Saludos - - Su última respuesta 7/4/2025 Modificadas por GerardoPcp 04 de abril de 2025, 9:06:2 Para agregar o quitar carpeta se hace con la suscripción de la cuenta - (clic botón derecho del mouse sobre la cuenta de correo) - en las cuentas IMAP, entiendo que su cuenta es IMAP y según me comento esta opción no aparece en la cuenta de yahoo. Otras opciones : Que la carpeta "correos no deseados" se haya movido sin querer a otra carpeta, habría que revisar el resto de las carpetas. Saludos - - - 20/07/2025. Hola, Si me responde en otra consulta se me hace difícil seguir el hilo del problema ya que no veo lo que le respondí antes. Para agregar o quitar carpeta se hace con la suscripción de la cuenta (clic botón derecho del mouse sobre la cuenta de correo) en las cuentas IMAP, su cuenta es IMAP ? Según me comento esta opción no aparece en su cuenta de yahoo, sin embargo, agregue mi cuenta de Yahoo al Thunderbird y si tiene la opción de suscripción, Otras opciones : Que la carpeta "correos no deseado" se haya movido sin querer a otra carpeta, habría que revisar el resto de las carpetas. Si su cuenta es POP3 lamentablemente ya he dejado de usar hace muchos años las cuentas POP3 y hay muy pocos usuarios que todavía siguen usándola. - - - 21/07/2025. Estoy usando POP3 y no IMAP. Por favor - no lo tome a mal - donde tengo el error entonces ? Le adjunto 5 capturas de pantalla. Gracias.!!!
creator: pamenico1234
